title: Strengthening Web Development Practical Skills: Activity-Centered Collaborative e-Learning Mathematics Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can apply activity-centered design methodologies to solve work-related mathematical problems.
Learners can collaborate with team members in mobile environments to design and share microlearning content.

Within one week, learners present solutions applying mathematical approaches (optimization theory, probabilistic modeling, etc.) to two real-world work problems (e.g., resource optimization, algorithm efficiency improvement) in project-based assessments and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least two of the three rubric items (problem definition clarity, methodological appropriateness, result validity)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
